subnotes.content:
The series, which spans the years 1931-1995, is divided into three subseries:

(a) Scrapbooks and photographs (1930-1989)

The bulk of the scrapbooks and photographs are separated or supplementary material to the Grant files (Series 3). Projects and individuals highlighted in this subseries include: the Tavistock Institute of Child Development; the Hampstead Child Therapy Course and Clinic; the Harvard Grant Study; the Harvard/Yale Florence Research Project; the Stanford University Gombe Stream Research Center; and Jane Goodall. 

Comprising this subseries are photographs and negatives from annual reports, and of Foundation trustees and officers, staff, and the W.T. Grant Commission.  These images relate to or were separated from Series 4, Administrative records. 

(b) Oversize material (1936-1999)

Consists of one box of newspapers, publications, posters, photographs, and other oversize material separated from Series 1-4.

(c) Audiovisual and digital material (1936-1997)

Consists of 27 reels of 16 millimeter film separated from Grant files (Series 3), including films by the Tavistock Institute of Human Relations; Syracuse University; Institute for Child Mental Health; Case Western Reserve University; the Gifted-Talented Institute; Hospital Audiences; Mount Sinai School of Medicine; Stanford University; Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania; and the Mental Health Film Board. DVD and videocassette copies of the Tavistock Institute films are also included in this subseries.

Also included are a small number of videocassettes, audiocassettes, and 5.25" floppy discs of material separated from the following grant files: the University of Michigan, Children's Health Futures, and Twin Cities Public Television.
